+166: def calc_chi(double L, double rot1, double rot2, double rot3,
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_3src_9_geometry_3calc_chi(PyObject *__pyx_self, PyObject *__pyx_args, PyObject *__pyx_kwds); /*proto*/
static char __pyx_doc_3src_9_geometry_2calc_chi[] = "\n    Calculate the chi array (azimuthal angles) in parallel\n\n    X1 = p1*cos(rot2)*cos(rot3) + p2*(cos(rot3)*sin(rot1)*sin(rot2) - cos(rot1)*sin(rot3)) -  L*(cos(rot1)*cos(rot3)*sin(rot2) + sin(rot1)*sin(rot3))\n    X2 = p1*cos(rot2)*sin(rot3) - L*(-(cos(rot3)*sin(rot1)) + cos(rot1)*sin(rot2)*sin(rot3)) +  p2*(cos(rot1)*cos(rot3) + sin(rot1)*sin(rot2)*sin(rot3))\n    X3 = -(L*cos(rot1)*cos(rot2)) + p2*cos(rot2)*sin(rot1) - p1*sin(rot2)\n    tan(Chi) =  X2 / X1\n\n\n    @param L: distance sample - PONI\n    @param rot1: angle1\n    @param rot2: angle2\n    @param rot3: angle3\n    @param pos1: numpy array with distances in meter along dim1 from PONI (Y)\n    @param pos2: numpy array with distances in meter along dim2 from PONI (X)\n    @param pos3: numpy array with distances in meter along Sample->PONI (Z), positive behind the detector\n    @return: ndarray of double with same shape and size as pos1\n    ";

 170:     """
 171:     Calculate the chi array (azimuthal angles) in parallel
 172: 
 173:     X1 = p1*cos(rot2)*cos(rot3) + p2*(cos(rot3)*sin(rot1)*sin(rot2) - cos(rot1)*sin(rot3)) -  L*(cos(rot1)*cos(rot3)*sin(rot2) + sin(rot1)*sin(rot3))
 174:     X2 = p1*cos(rot2)*sin(rot3) - L*(-(cos(rot3)*sin(rot1)) + cos(rot1)*sin(rot2)*sin(rot3)) +  p2*(cos(rot1)*cos(rot3) + sin(rot1)*sin(rot2)*sin(rot3))
 175:     X3 = -(L*cos(rot1)*cos(rot2)) + p2*cos(rot2)*sin(rot1) - p1*sin(rot2)
 176:     tan(Chi) =  X2 / X1
 177: 
 178: 
 179:     @param L: distance sample - PONI
 180:     @param rot1: angle1
 181:     @param rot2: angle2
 182:     @param rot3: angle3
 183:     @param pos1: numpy array with distances in meter along dim1 from PONI (Y)
 184:     @param pos2: numpy array with distances in meter along dim2 from PONI (X)
 185:     @param pos3: numpy array with distances in meter along Sample->PONI (Z), positive behind the detector
 186:     @return: ndarray of double with same shape and size as pos1
 187:     """
 188:     cdef:

 225:     Calculate the q (scattering vector) array in parallel
 226: 
 227:     X1 = p1*cos(rot2)*cos(rot3) + p2*(cos(rot3)*sin(rot1)*sin(rot2) - cos(rot1)*sin(rot3)) -  L*(cos(rot1)*cos(rot3)*sin(rot2) + sin(rot1)*sin(rot3))

 229:     X3 = -(L*cos(rot1)*cos(rot2)) + p2*cos(rot2)*sin(rot1) - p1*sin(rot2)
 230:     tan(Chi) =  X2 / X1
 231: 
 232:

 234:     @param rot1: angle1

 236:     @param rot3: angle3

+245:         double cosRot1 = cos(rot1)

+246:         double sinRot2 = sin(rot2)

+249:         double cosRot3 = cos(rot3)
